, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An antibiotic is a\nchemical made by certain bacteria (or fungi) that either kills other bacteria\nor inhibits their growth or reproduction. Doctors prescribe antibiotics to\ndestroy harmful bacteria that are causing disease.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soil is a wonderful source\nof bacteria that can make new antibiotics which can kill bacteria in human body\nwhich are resistant to antibotics medicines. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some antibiotics block\nthe production of the cell wall in bacteria. Human cells don't have a cell\nwall, so they are unharmed by the chemicals. We need to repeatedly find new\nantibiotics because of a phenomenon known as antibiotic resistance. In this\nsituation, an antibiotic that once killed a harmful bacterium no longer works.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The microbe is said to have become resistant to the chemical. Antibiotic\nresistance develops due to genetic changes in bacteria. These changes are a\nnatural part of a bacterium's life.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Transfer of genes from one individual to\nanother, mutations (alterations in genes), and transfer of genes by viruses that\ninfect bacteria give the microbes new characteristics. It also means that the\nmembers of a bacterial population are not completely identical genetically.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a bacterial\npopulation is attacked by an antibiotic, many of the bacteria may be killed.\nSome members of the population may survive because they have a gene (or genes)\nthat enables them to resist the attack, however. When these resistant bacteria\nreproduce, some of their offspring will also have the helpful gene. A large\npopulation of resistant organisms may eventually form.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Antibiotic resistance\nis very worrying. If we can't find new ways to kill bacteria, some infections\nmay become untreatable. Some serious diseases have already become much harder\nto treat. The search for new antibiotics made by soil bacteria is therefore\nvery important.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MRSA stands for\nmethicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus. This bacterium produces a very\nproblematic infection because it's resistant to many common antibiotics. The\ninfection can still be treated, but the treatment is often difficult because\nthe number of drugs that affects the bacterium is decreasing.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-xYPKKA0TZaE/XJ-941vlV-I/AAAAAAABgcA/w0Y86kNcRUAS7gJe0frozAF_B6tyBwUBQCLcBGAs/s1600/T-supserBugs-enSB2.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"290\" data-original-width=\"210\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-xYPKKA0TZaE/XJ-941vlV-I/AAAAAAABgcA/w0Y86kNcRUAS7gJe0frozAF_B6tyBwUBQCLcBGAs/s400/T-supserBugs-enSB2.gif\" width=\"289\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Healthy soil is a rich\nsource of bacteria. A significant number of these microbes might produce\nchemicals that could be used as human medicines. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the most useful\nabilities of bacteria as far as humans are concerned is to make antibiotics. An\nantibiotic is a chemical made by certain bacteria (or fungi) that either kills\nother bacteria or inhibits their growth or reproduction. Doctors prescribe\nantibiotics to destroy harmful bacteria that are causing disease.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soils supply plants\nwith nutrients, most of which are held in place by particles of clay and\norganic matter (colloids).&nbsp;&nbsp; The\nnutrients may be aDsorbed on clay mineral surfaces, bound within clay minerals\n(absorbed), or bound within organic compounds as part of the living organisms\nor dead soil organic matter.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These bound nutrients interact with soil water to\nbuffer the soil solution composition (attenuate changes in the soil solution)\nas soils wet up or dry out, as plants take up nutrients, as salts are leached,\nor as acids or alkalis are added.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Biochar removes organic\nmicropollutants from water via adsorption.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Q_22eS8pZGI/XJ-68rFlGhI/AAAAAAABgbA/8q8yHgiR7zY9PoTKzvCxbtdYtzPueD4QgCLcBGAs/s1600/H2sO%252BDNA%252B%252B%252BBiochar%252BProperties%252BIon%252BAdsorption%252B%253D%252B%253D%252Bwater%252B%25E2%2588%2592%252B%25E2%2588%2592%252B%25E2%2588%2592%252B%25E2%2588%2592.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"720\" data-original-width=\"960\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Q_22eS8pZGI/XJ-68rFlGhI/AAAAAAABgbA/8q8yHgiR7zY9PoTKzvCxbtdYtzPueD4QgCLcBGAs/s640/H2sO%252BDNA%252B%252B%252BBiochar%252BProperties%252BIon%252BAdsorption%252B%253D%252B%253D%252Bwater%252B%25E2%2588%2592%252B%25E2%2588%2592%252B%25E2%2588%2592%252B%25E2%2588%2592.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">INDIANS HAVE BEEN\nBURNING CROP STUBBLE SINCE TIME IMMEMORIAL..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">INDIANS WERE VEGANS AND WERE THE\nFIRST TO DO ORGANIC AGRICULTURE TO PRODUCE&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">GRAIN AND PULSES.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fire is a powerful regenerating force. This\nis why prescribed burns are useful management tools in forests and rangelands\nto clear out old growth, stimulate new growth and recycle nutrients.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The microorganisms that\nare killed by fire near the soil surface, where temperatures are greatest\nduring a fire, become food for the survivors that escape by living deeper down\nor by being protected within the occasional soil aggregate (bound-up clusters\nof soil particles that may encase microbes and protect them from high\ntemperatures).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHAT MUST BE REMEMBERED\nDURING A FOREST FIRE IS THAT HEAT TRAVELS UPWARDS IN SECONDS, SIDEWAYS IN\nMINUTES AND DOWNWARDS IN HOURS..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soil organic carbon is\nthe basis of soil fertility. It releases nutrients for plant growth, promotes\nthe structure, biological and physical health of soil, and is a buffer against\nharmful substances..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Organic material is\nmanufactured by plants using carbon dioxide from the air and water.. Soil\norganic carbon tends to be concentrated in the topsoil<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CARBON DIOXIDE IS A\nLIFE SUSTAINING GAS , NOT A BAD GAS AS PER PROPAGANDA OF \u201cCHAMPION OF EARTH\u201d JEW\nDARLING MODI\u2014 IN HIS ATTEMPT TO MOTHBALL OUR ENORMOUS RESERVES OF COAL. .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/12/poland-katowice-cop-24-global-warming.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/12/poland-katowice-cop-24-global-warming.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/12/global-warming-climate-change-fear.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/12/global-warming-climate-change-fear.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/02/america-caused-global-warming-with_9.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/02/america-caused-global-warming-with_9.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plants (and animals, as\npart of the food chain), die and return to the soil where they are decomposed\nand recycled. Minerals are released into the soil and carbon dioxide is\nreleased into the atmosphere.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A fertile and healthy\nsoil is the basis for healthy plants, animals, and humans. And soil organic\nmatter is the very foundation for healthy and productive soils.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Without an atmosphere,\nthe Earth would be a rocky planet with no oceans, clouds or life. The mix of\ngases and conditions in the Earth's atmosphere make life possible.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plants and\nanimals need the gases in the air to survive, and the protection the atmosphere\nprovides helps sustain life as well. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plants use carbon\ndioxide to grow and sustain life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GLOBAL WARMING HAS\nNOTHING TO DO WITH CARBON DIXODE.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THIS FOUL LIE IS JUST A RUSE FOR JEWS TO MAKE\nMONEY OUT OF THIN AIR BY CARBON TAXES..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CARBON DIOXIDE IS BEING\nBRANDED AS A GREENHOUSE GAS SO THAT INDIA WILL MOTHBALL OUR COAL <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WATER VAPOUR IS&nbsp; THE MOST DOMIANNT GREENHOUSE GAS .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Salah in southern\nAlgeria, a r noon high of 52 degrees Celsius was recorded &nbsp;\u2013 by midnight that night at the same place it\nwas -3.6 degree Celsius. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Atacama desert noon\ntemperatures can get as high as 55\u00b0C. At night, the temperature fall to &nbsp;-3.3 degree C.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That was caused because\nthere is no, or very little, water vapour in the atmosphere and it is a\ndemonstration of water vapour as the most important greenhouse gas. Water in\nthe ground and in the atmosphere is very good at storing heat from the day and\nreleasing it slowly over the night, producing milder climates in wetter regions\nof the world.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zmDzFuGLuYg/XJ-7ZuomJUI/AAAAAAABgbI/-hwOXrGbLHk2PQO0jRump4m1WQzS30ENQCLcBGAs/s1600/Greenhouse%252BGases%252BA%252Bgreenhouse%252Bgas%252B%2528GHG%2529%252Bis%252Baddny%252Bgas%252Bin%252Bthe%252Batmosphere%252Bthat%252Babsorbs%252Blower-energy%252Binfrared%252Bradiation..jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"720\" data-original-width=\"960\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zmDzFuGLuYg/XJ-7ZuomJUI/AAAAAAABgbI/-hwOXrGbLHk2PQO0jRump4m1WQzS30ENQCLcBGAs/s640/Greenhouse%252BGases%252BA%252Bgreenhouse%252Bgas%252B%2528GHG%2529%252Bis%252Baddny%252Bgas%252Bin%252Bthe%252Batmosphere%252Bthat%252Babsorbs%252Blower-energy%252Binfrared%252Bradiation..jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE PLANET GREENS WHEN\nTHERE IS MORE CO2 IN THE ATMOSPHERE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When CO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria math&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> levels rise, plants\ndon\u2019t need to open their \u201cstomata\u201d as much to absorb the same amount of CO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria math&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">. This also reduces the\nloss of water through the same pores\u2026Both more CO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria math&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> and saving water increases plant growth.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stomata are small pores in the underside of the leaf that allow gas exchange\nwhere water vapor leaves the plant and carbon dioxide enters. Special cells\ncalled guard cells control each pore\u2019s opening or closing. When stomata are\nopen, transpiration rates increase; when they are closed, transpiration rates\ndecrease.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-M1CBROEe1WY/XJ-7qks-XoI/AAAAAAABgbM/-9fK7c_EmHkxIms81euNTpc5PWQXJBEIACLcBGAs/s1600/stomsata.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"218\" data-original-width=\"313\" height=\"445\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-M1CBROEe1WY/XJ-7qks-XoI/AAAAAAABgbM/-9fK7c_EmHkxIms81euNTpc5PWQXJBEIACLcBGAs/s640/stomsata.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plants open and close their stomata in response to changes in their\nenvironment so they can get the CO2 they need, and avoid drying out. Plants\nneed CO2 to enter and O2 to exit. Stomata close when it is dark and dry, unless\ncarbon dioxide levels inside the leaf start to fall. Plant stomata close in\ndarkness and when conditions are very dry.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-S2rto5t0dbA/XJ-8B61053I/AAAAAAABgbY/nw54Uefhe5AKakNCVmzMQ1KqR7_zGgzXgCLcBGAs/s1600/hqddefault.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"360\" data-original-width=\"480\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-S2rto5t0dbA/XJ-8B61053I/AAAAAAABgbY/nw54Uefhe5AKakNCVmzMQ1KqR7_zGgzXgCLcBGAs/s640/hqddefault.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since plant cells need carbon\ndioxide for photosynthesis, carbon dioxide concentrations are another key\nfactor. If carbon dioxide concentrations inside the leaf start to fall, the\nplant will open its stomata so that more CO2 can enter, even under dry\nconditions when the stomata would ordinarily be closed.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Falling carbon dioxide\nconcentrations trigger a biochemical pathway that makes the stomata reopen.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As soil organic matter\ndecreases, it becomes increasingly difficult to grow plants, because problems\nwith fertility, water availability, compaction, erosion, parasites, diseases,\nand insects become more common. If attention is paid to proper organic matter\nmanagement, the soil can support a good crop without the need for artificial\nfertilisers and pesticides.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plants need eighteen\nchemical elements for their growth\u2014carbon (C), hydrogen (H), oxygen (O),\nnitrogen (N), phosphorus (P), potassium (K), sulfur (S), calcium (Ca),\nmagnesium (Mg), iron (Fe), manganese (Mn), boron (B), zinc (Zn), molybdenum\n(Mo), nickel (Ni), copper (Cu), cobalt (Co), and chlorine (Cl).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plants obtain\ncarbon as carbon dioxide (CO2) and oxygen partially as oxygen gas (O2) from the\nair. The remaining essential elements are obtained mainly from the soil. The\navailability of these nutrients is influenced either directly or indirectly by\nthe presence of organic matter.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The elements needed in large amounts\u2014carbon,\nhydrogen, oxygen, nitrogen, phosphorus, potassium, calcium, magnesium,\nsulfur\u2014are called macronutrients. The other elements, called micronutrients,\nare essential elements needed in small amounts. (Sodium [Na] helps many plants\ngrow better, but it is not considered essential to plant growth and\nreproduction.)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most of the nutrients\nin soil organic matter can\u2019t be used by plants as long as those nutrients exist\nas part of large organic molecules. As soil organisms decompose organic or\nmineral forms that plants can easily use. This process, called mineralization,\nprovides much of the nitrogen that plants need by converting it from organic\nforms.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, proteins are\nconverted to ammonium (NH4+) and then to nitrate (NO3\u2013). Most plants will take\nup the majority of their nitrogen from soils in the form of nitrate. The\nmineralization of organic matter is also an important mechanism for supplying\nplants with such nutrients as phosphorus and sulfur and most of the\nmicronutrients. This release of nutrients from organic matter by mineralization\nis part of a larger agricultural nutrient cycle<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Decomposing organic\nmatter can feed plants directly, but it also can indirectly benefit the\nnutrition of the plant. A number of essential nutrients occur in soils as\npositively charged molecules called cations.. As I have explained in great\ndetail before, the ability of organic matter to hold on to cations in a way\nthat keeps them available to plants is known as cation exchange capacity (CEC).\nHumus has many negative charges<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because opposite\ncharges attract, humus is able to hold on to positively charged nutrients, such\nas calcium (Ca++), potassium (K+), and magnesium (Mg++) (see figure 2.5a). This\nkeeps them from leaching deep into the subsoil when water moves through the\ntopsoil.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nutrients held in this way can be gradually released into the soil\nsolution and made available to plants throughout the growing season. However,\nkeep in mind that not all plant nutrients occur as cations. For example, the\nnitrate form of nitrogen is negatively charged (NO3\u2013) and is actually repelled\nby the negatively charged CEC. Therefore, nitrate leaches easily as water moves\ndown through the soil and beyond the root zone.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Clay particles also\nhave negative charges on their surfaces , but organic matter may be the major\nsource of negative charges for coarse and medium-textured soils.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-YuiFfgxFmZg/XJ-8VHkspBI/AAAAAAABgbg/25hA6bDPhQAD1eXGm2uZ30Z5KKBwO6EowCLcBGAs/s1600/0032x_talajtan.bmp\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"400\" data-original-width=\"570\" height=\"448\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-YuiFfgxFmZg/XJ-8VHkspBI/AAAAAAABgbg/25hA6bDPhQAD1eXGm2uZ30Z5KKBwO6EowCLcBGAs/s640/0032x_talajtan.bmp\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Organic molecules in\nthe soil may also hold on to and protect certain nutrients. These particles,\ncalled \u201cchelates\u201d are by-products of the active decomposition of organic\nmaterials and are smaller than the particles that make up humus. In general,\nelements are held more strongly by chelates than by binding of positive and\nnegative charges.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ZrnyRBPFg4k/XJ-84OhknsI/AAAAAAABgbo/y8G2VZI6_xE-22UZ5aPfLa-KEZT-icffQCLcBGAs/s1600/Chselate2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"286\" data-original-width=\"873\" height=\"208\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ZrnyRBPFg4k/XJ-84OhknsI/AAAAAAABgbo/y8G2VZI6_xE-22UZ5aPfLa-KEZT-icffQCLcBGAs/s640/Chselate2.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chelates work well because they bind the nutrient at more\nthan one location on the organic molecule . In some soils, trace elements, such\nas iron, zinc, and manganese, would be converted to unavailable forms if they\nwere not bound by chelates. It is not uncommon to find low-organic-matter soils\nor exposed subsoils deficient in these micronutrients.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soil organisms are\nessential for keeping plants well supplied with nutrients because they break\ndown organic matter. These organisms make nutrients available by freeing them\nfrom organic molecules. Some bacteria fix nitrogen gas from the atmosphere,\nmaking it available to plants. Other organisms dissolve minerals and make\nphosphorus more available. If soil organisms aren\u2019t present and active, more\nfertilizers will be needed to supply plant nutrients.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When soil has a favorable\nphysical condition for growing plants, it is said to have good tilth. Such a\nsoil is porous and allows water to enter easily, instead of running off the\nsurface. More water is stored in the soil for plants to use between rains, and\nless erosion occurs.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Good tilth also means that the soil is well aerated. Roots\ncan easily obtain oxygen and get rid of carbon dioxide. A porous soil does not\nrestrict root development and exploration. When a soil has poor tilth, the\nsoil\u2019s structure deteriorates and soil aggregates break down, causing increased\ncompaction and decreased aeration and water storage. A soil layer can become so\ncompacted that roots can\u2019t grow.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-3UfzqOB9lro/XJ-9N0EpimI/AAAAAAABgbw/NRUKaho-jpAT9kelIXh2HRK3uKn63V-GQCLcBGAs/s1600/main-qimg-73d3a683b635fccff80410dd09d8f56bb.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"391\" data-original-width=\"520\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-3UfzqOB9lro/XJ-9N0EpimI/AAAAAAABgbw/NRUKaho-jpAT9kelIXh2HRK3uKn63V-GQCLcBGAs/s640/main-qimg-73d3a683b635fccff80410dd09d8f56bb.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A soil with excellent physical properties will\nhave numerous channels and pores of many different sizes. As organic matter\nincreases, soils tend to be less compact and have more space for air passage\nand water storage. Sticky substances are produced during the decomposition of\nplant residues. Along with plant roots and fungal hyphae, they bind mineral\nparticles together into clumps, or aggregates.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In addition, the sticky\nsecretions of mycorrhizal fungi\u2014beneficial fungi that enter roots and help\nplants get more water and nutrients\u2014are important binding material in soils.\nThe arrangement and collection of minerals as aggregates and the degree of soil\ncompaction have huge effects on plant growth. I have explained all this in\ngreat detail before.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ztuvloSsY00/XJ-9imPCPnI/AAAAAAABgb4/dXCyAcpHw9A6oTPptbr6-ygbb5gbXxqvwCLcBGAs/s1600/What_are_Mycdorrhizal_Fungi.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"676\" data-original-width=\"1200\" height=\"360\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ztuvloSsY00/XJ-9imPCPnI/AAAAAAABgb4/dXCyAcpHw9A6oTPptbr6-ygbb5gbXxqvwCLcBGAs/s640/What_are_Mycdorrhizal_Fungi.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img alt=\"\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/03/holi-2019-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html?showComment=1553935347096#c6517126463851287329\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">March 30, 2019 at 2:12 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nJUST NOW I SAW CONGRESS SPOKESMAN PC CHACKO PRAISING THE GREEN KHER<br />\nMEENAKSHI LEKHI<br />\nSMRITI IRANI<br />\nPC GEORGE<br />\nJANAM TV<br />\nGEN GD BAKSHI<br />\nSAMBIT PATRA<br />\nRSN SINGH<br />\nSHASHI THAROOR<br />\nCHETAN BHAGAT<br />\nCLOSET COMMIE ARNAB GOSWMI<br />\nRAJDEEP SARDESAI<br />\nNAVIKA KUMAR<br />\nZAKKA JACOB<br />\nANAND NARASIMHAN<br />\nVIKRAM CHANDRA<br />\nNIDHI RAZDAN<br />\nPRANNOY JAMES ROY<br />\nAROON PURIE<br />\nVINEET JAIN<br />\nRAGHAV BAHL<br />\nSEEMA CHISTI<br />\nDILEEP PADGOANKAR<br />\nVIR SANGHVI<br />\nPRASOON JOSHI<br />\nALL CONGRESS SPOKESMEN<br />\nRAHUL GANDHI<br />\nSONIA GANDHI<br />\nPRIYANKA GANDHI<br />\nBARKHA DUTT<br />\nSHEKHAR GUPTA<br />\nSIDHARTH VARADARAJAN<br />\nN RAM<br />\nMANI SHANKAR AIYERAN<br />\nROMILA THAPAR<br />\nIRFAN HABIB<br />\nNIVEDITA MENON<br />\nAYESHA KIDWAI<br />\nPAVAN VARMA<br />\nRAMACHANDRA GUHA<br />\nDANIEL RAJA<br />\nBRINDA KARAT<br />\nPRAKASH KARAT<br />\nSITARAM YECHURY<br />\nSUMEET CHOPRA<br />\nDINESH VARSHNEY<br />\nANNA href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/03/holi-2019-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html?showComment=1553938466922#c8308403184793796184\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">March 30, 2019 at 3:04 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttps://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/03/questions-from-capt-ajit-vadakayil-for.html<br />\n<br />\nhttps://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/03/india-must-revert-to-organic_26.html<br />\n<br />\nSEND ABOVE LINKS TO VANDANA SHIVA..<br />\n<br />\nTELL HER, CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL SAYS THAT--<br />\n<br />\n\" VANDANA SHIVA MUST INCREASE THE SIZE OF HER BINDI -- TO DOUBLE-- , TO IMPROVE HER PERSONALITY .. NEVER MIND IF HER FOREHEAD IS COMPLETELY COVERED BY IT \"<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-UorUp9ndrT4/XJ84lcxveBI/AAAAAAABgZ0/4mJ6Q3wqZ-08QEiFxFwkcL-bJz8aMIEcQCLcBGAs/s1600/imassges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"183\" data-original-width=\"276\" height=\"265\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-UorUp9ndrT4/XJ84lcxveBI/AAAAAAABgZ0/4mJ6Q3wqZ-08QEiFxFwkcL-bJz8aMIEcQCLcBGAs/s400/imassges.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img alt=\"\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/03/india-must-revert-to-organic_26.html?showComment=1553969407436#c1280899469309352920\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">March 30, 2019 at 11:40 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nSOMEBODY ASKED ME<br />\n<br />\nWHAT WAS THE REASON FOR THAT SWIPE AT VANDANA SHIVA<br />\n<br />\nWELL , SHE IS THE \u201c<b><span style=\"color: red;\">CATs WHISKERS</span></b> \u201c IN THE FIELD OF ORGANIC FARMING..<br />\n<br />\nShe received the Right Livelihood Award in 1993, an honor known as an \"Alternative Nobel Prize\".<br />\n<br />\nIF I WERE TO PUT HER THROUGH AN OBJECTIVE EXAM ON BASICS , SHE WONT EVEN SCORE 3%..<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/09/gm-ir8-rice-high-amylose-content.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/09/gm-ir8-rice-high-amylose-content.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Degradation and\nsorption are both factors which influence the persistence of pesticides in\nsoil. Depending on the chemical nature of the pesticide, such processes control\ndirectly the transportation from soil to water, and in turn to air and our\nfood.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Breaking down organic substances, degradation, involves interactions\namong microorganisms in the soil. Sorption affects bioaccumulation of\npesticides which are dependent on organic matter in the soil. Weak organic\nacids have been shown to be weakly sorbed by soil, because of pH and mostly\nacidic structure. Sorbed chemicals have been shown to be less accessible to\nmicroorganisms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrogen fixation,\nwhich is required for the growth of higher plants, is hindered by pesticides in\nsoil. The insecticides DDT, methyl parathion, and especially pentachlorophenol\nhave been shown to interfere with legume-rhizobium chemical signaling.\nReduction of this symbiotic chemical signaling results in reduced nitrogen\nfixation and thus reduced crop yields.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pesticides can kill\nbees and are strongly implicated in pollinator decline, the loss of species\nthat pollinate plants, including through the mechanism of Colony Collapse\nDisorder, in which worker bees from a beehive or western honey bee colony\nabruptly disappear.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Application of pesticides to crops that are in bloom can\nkill honeybees, which act as pollinators. The, pesticides have direct harmful\neffect on plant including poor root hair development, shoot yellowing and\nreduced plant growth.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rhizosphere is the area\naround a plant root that is inhabited by a unique population of microorganisms\ninfluenced,&nbsp; by the chemicals released\nfrom plant roots. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The rhizosphere an\ninformation super highway, for transferring data using exudates and\ncommunities.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plant roots penetrate\nsoil horizons and open channels upon decomposition. Plants with deep taproots\ncan penetrate many metres through the different soil layers to bring up\nnutrients from deeper in the profile.&nbsp;\nPlants have fine roots that excrete organic compounds (sugars, organic\nacids, mucigel), slough off cells (in particular at their tip) and are easily\ndecomposed, adding organic matter to soil, a process called rhizodeposition.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-UxGO3RkFBqA/XJ-39C-VcPI/AAAAAAABga4/zvy7uNoiiVUe2W7xZSLXkg5GGyHLc-7EACLcBGAs/s1600/Rhizodedposition.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"720\" data-original-width=\"1280\" height=\"360\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-UxGO3RkFBqA/XJ-39C-VcPI/AAAAAAABga4/zvy7uNoiiVUe2W7xZSLXkg5GGyHLc-7EACLcBGAs/s640/Rhizodedposition.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rhizodeposition&nbsp; as all material lost from plant roots,\nincluding water-soluble exudates, secretions of insoluble materials, lysates,\ndead fine roots, and gases, such as CO2 and ethylene he sources of organic\nC-input from roots can be divided into two main groups: ---(1) water-soluble\nexudates, for example sugars, amino acids, organic acids, and so on; and (2)\nwater-insoluble materials, for example sloughed cells and mucilage. Materials\nin the first group are rapidly metabolized by rhizosphere microorganisms.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There\nare three sources of CO2 released by a system of living roots and soil: ---(1)\nroot respiration; (2) microbial respiration utilizing root-derived materials\n(rhizo-microbial respiration); and (3) microbial respiration using original\nsoil carbon. This intimate association of root respiration and exudation with\nrhizo-microbial respiration has made studies of root respiration, root\nexudation, and rhizo-microbial respiration in natural soils very difficult.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The growth of roots\nthrough the soil stimulates microbial populations, stimulating in turn the\nactivity of their predators (notably amoeba), thereby increasing the\nmineralization rate, and in last turn root growth, a positive feedback called\nthe soil microbial loop.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Out of root\ninfluence, in the bulk soil, most bacteria are in a quiescent stage, forming\nmicroaggregates, i.e. mucilaginous colonies to which clay particles are glued,\noffering them a protection against desiccation and predation by soil microfauna\n(bacteriophagous protozoa and nematodes). Microaggregates are ingested by soil\nmesofauna and macrofauna, and bacterial bodies are partly or totally digested\nin their guts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sand is least active,\nhaving the least specific surface area, followed by silt; clay is the most\nactive. Sand's greatest benefit to soil is that it resists compaction and\nincreases soil porosity, although this property stands only for pure sand, not\nfor sand mixed with smaller minerals which fill the voids among sand grains.\nSilt is mineralogically like sand but with its higher specific surface area it\nis more chemically and physically active than sand.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But it is the clay content\nof soil, with its very high specific surface area and generally large number of\nnegative charges, that gives a soil its high retention capacity for water and\nnutrients. Clay soils also resist wind and water erosion better than silty and\nsandy soils, as the particles bond tightly to each other,and that with a strong\nmitigation effect of organic matter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the organic\ncomponent of a soil is substantial, the soil is called organic soil rather than\nmineral soil. A soil is called organic if:--</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mineral fraction is 0%\nclay and organic matter is 20% or more<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mineral fraction is 0%\nto 50% clay and organic matter is between 20% and 30%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mineral fraction is 50%\nor more clay</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many of the chemicals\nused in pesticides are persistent soil contaminants, whose impact endure for\ndecades and adversely affect soil conservation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The use of pesticides\ndecreases the general biodiversity in the soil. Not using the chemicals results\nin higher soil qualit with the additional effect that more organic matter in\nthe soil allows for higher water retention.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This helps increase yields for\nfarms in drought years, when organic farms have had yields 40% higher than\ntheir conventional counterparts. A smaller content of organic matter in the\nsoil increases the amount of pesticide that will leave the area of application,\nbecause organic matter binds to and helps break down pesticides.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<ol id=\"top-ra\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c2844602130896572588\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img alt=\"\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. When the cow first eats, it chews the food just enough to swallow it. The unchewed food travels to the first two stomachs, the rumen and the reticulum, where it is stored until later. When the cow is full from this eating process, she rests.<br />\n<br />\nLater, the cow coughs up bits of the unchewed food called cud and chews it completely this time before swallowing it again. The cud then goes to the third and fourth stomachs, the omasum and abomasum, where it is fully digested. Some of this digested food enters the bloodstream and travels to a bag called the udder, where it is made into milk that will come out of her teats, while the rest goes towards the cow's nourishment.<br />\n<br />\nThis is why the HUMPED cow\u2019s dung and urine is not a YUCK thing--unlike the HUMPLESS cow ..<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/02/gomutra-drinking-cows-urine-as-elexir.html<br />\n<br />\nGomutra has copper ions which do NOT allow fat to deposit and lowers the levels of cholestrol.
