, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soil organic matter\n(SOM) is the organic matter component of soil, consisting of plant and animal\nresidues at various stages of decomposition, cells and tissues of soil\norganisms, and substances synthesized by soil organisms.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SOM exerts numerous\npositive effects on soil physical and chemical properties, as well as the\nsoil\u2019s capacity to provide regulatory ecosystem services. Particularly, the\npresence of SOM is regarded as being critical for soil functions and soil\nquality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Humic substances\nclassification--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a\nclassification into three groups, based on solubility in acids and alkalis, and\nalso related to stability.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fulvic acid is the\ngroup which contains the materials that have the lowest molecular weight, and\nare soluble in acids and alkali, and susceptible to microbial attack.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Humic acid group\ncontains the intermediate materials, with medium molecular weight, soluble in\nalkali, but insoluble in acid, and intermediate resistance to microbial attack.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Humin is the generic\nname for the materials with highest molecular weight, that are darkest in\ncolor, insoluble in acid and alkali, and with the most resistance to microbial\nattack.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Crop rotation may be an\neffective means to prevent a parasitic population from becoming\nwell-established, as an organism affecting leaves would be starved when the\nleafy crop is replaced by a tuberous type, etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soil acidification\nreduces soil biodiversity. It reduces the numbers of most macrofauna,\nincluding, for example, earthworm numbers (important in maintaining structural\nquality of the topsoil for plant growth). Also affected is rhizobium survival\nand persistence.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Decomposition and nitrogen fixation may be reduced, which\naffects the survival of native vegetation. Biodiversity may further decline as\ncertain weeds proliferate under declining native vegetation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Extended exposure to\nhigh sodium levels results in a decrease in the amount of water retained and\nable to flow through soil, as well as a decrease in decomposition rates (this\nleaves the soil infertile and prohibit any future growth). As the salinity of\nthe soil rises, there is more stress on microbes because there is less\navailable water available to them, leading to less respiration.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Green manure acts\nmainly as soil-acidifying matter to decrease the alkalinity/pH of alkali soils\nby generating humic acid and acetic acid.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The value of green\nmanure was recognized by farmers in India for thousands of years, as mentioned\nin treatises like Vrikshayurveda.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">COWS SUSTAINED ORGANIC\nAGRICULTURE AND OVER MILLENNIUMS WE CREATED SIX FEET THICK TOP SOIL TEEMING\nWITH HEALTHY MICROBES/ FUNGI --WHILE THE REST OF THE PLANET HAS TOP SOIL ONLY A\nFEW INCHES THICK..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NOW THE WHITE JEW WANTS\nTO USE INDIAN TOP SOIL AS A GUINEA PIG FOR TESTING THEIR GM SOIL MICROBES AND GM\nFUNGI..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CO2 IS A GOOD\nGAS..&nbsp; INCREASED CO2 IN THE ATMOSPHERE\nINCREASES THE LEVELS OF GLOMALIN<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GLOMALIN REDUCED\nNITROGEN LOSSES FROM THE SOIL- AND HENCE THERE IS NO NEED TO APPLY EXCESS\nARTIFICIAL FERTILISERS AND UREA TO PROVIDE NITROGEN..</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Crop stubble burning\nbecomes essential because combine harvester leaves crop residue behind.\nCombines are machines that harvest the crops as well as thresh, means\nseparation of the grain, and it's cleaning together, but it leaves stubble\nbehind because it doesn't cut close enough to the ground. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These residues put a burden on farmer's back\nbecause these residues are not so useful for the farmer and there is pressure\non the farmer to sow the next crop in time. Therefore, they clear the field by\nburning the stubble. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This crop stubble burning\nprocess has been going on in India for milliniums.. SMOG in Delhi is not due to\ncrop stubble burning.. Delhi is situated in an area where temperature inversion\ntakes place..</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The residues of rice\nand wheat crops are major contributors to the total stubble loads in India.\nThere are two main reasons for crop residue burning-&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">First one is that there is a very short\nwindow of time between the harvesting of paddy and sowing of wheat, at the end\nof the Kharif season.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Secondly, the removal of the paddy stalk that remains on\nthe field is a labor-intensive process. With labor being unavailable and the\ntime window between the harvesting of paddy and sowing of wheat is limited, the\nonly easiest option that the farmer has is burning the residue right on the\nfield.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For farmers, burning of residues is cheaper and requires less effort.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AND MOST IMPORTANT IT\nPRODUCED BIOCHAR , WHICH IS AN ESSENTIAL FOR ORGANIC AGRICULTURE..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tall grasses burn quick\nand hot, however, close to the ground where the roots start, air is excluded so\nthe base of the grasses will pyrolyze and not burn\u2026</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is how biochar is made and\nwe Indians have been doing it millenniums before the era when the white man was living in caves and\nrunning around naked doing GRUNT GRUNT for language.. We knew what we were doing !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>BELOW: WITHOUT LIVING SOIL-WE CANT GET GOOD DRINKING WATER</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>ARTIFICIAL FERTILIZERS AND PESTICIDES \"KILLS\" THE MICROBES AND FUNGI..</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/MlREaT9hFCw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/MlREaT9hFCw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbon is the most\nessential element of soil fertility. When organic matter is added to\nagricultural soils to increase carbon levels, most of it rapidly decomposes to\ncarbon dioxide and escapes to the atmosphere...<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Only a very small\npercentage eventually becomes stable humic matter... <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Humification is the\nnatural process of changing organic matter into humic substances (humus,\nhumate, humic acid, fulvic acid, and humin) by geo-microbiological mechanisms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Humification takes\ndecades to centuries..&nbsp; The process\ncreates a fine-grained, highly porous charcoal that helps soils retain\nnutrients and water\u2026.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/RY-JY-D4v7I/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/RY-JY-D4v7I?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SOM is formed by the\nbiological, chemical and physical decay of organic materials on the soil\nsurface and below the ground.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Organic matter is a\ncatch all phrase used to describe a wide range of molecules including starches,\nproteins, sugars, carbohydrates, amino acids etc.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When organic matter\nstarts to decompose these molecules are broken down into smaller and smaller\nmolecules by the micro-organisms in the soil (mostly bacteria and fungi).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/-dhdUoK7s2s/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/-dhdUoK7s2s?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;INDIA MUST FORM COMPULSORY ORGANIC FARMING\nZONES TO KICK AWAY GREEN REVOLUTION.. THIS MUST BE DONE IN STAGES..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ORGANIC\nFARMERS MUST BE GIVEN SUBSIDY..&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-gmtCzXSheNo/XKNaPN8oBxI/AAAAAAABgfI/2v1kz7NwsZQ3QdqBQoDSNyPYLRLp-OBNgCLcBGAs/s1600/honey-bee-poEllinator-food_0.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">INDIA HAS LOST 65% OF OUR BEE POPULATION IN JUST 55 YEARS OF GREEN REVOLUTION\nINVOLVING ARTIFICIAL FERTILIZERS AND PESTICIDES..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/LF0UCfqNdaM/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/LF0UCfqNdaM?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Z7AsBq6-1xs/XKNcfwWlKcI/AAAAAAABgfk/ddH_b6pEnxQybDHdamtRtFEto0zlgAiyQCLcBGAs/s1600/mSqdefault.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
