text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Xfn3JSQc3fc/XKNbHKnAJEI/AAAAAAABgfY/c7Sj2OxxH9wg4mA25DfT_t4Ejca1rATxQCLcBGAs/s1600/beFes-dying.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"442\" data-original-width=\"444\" height=\"636\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Xfn3JSQc3fc/XKNbHKnAJEI/AAAAAAABgfY/c7Sj2OxxH9wg4mA25DfT_t4Ejca1rATxQCLcBGAs/s640/beFes-dying.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">ORGANIC AGRICULTURE\nCANNOT BE DONE BY MONO CROPPING.<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">THE GOVT MUST KEEP A\nRECORD OF CROPS GROWN BY FARMERS WITH PHOTOS&nbsp; ..</span></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">THE DISTRICT COLLECTOR\nMUST BE PART OF THIS CRITICAL EFFORT, AS WE CANT TRUST POLITICIANS TO BE HONEST ABOUT THIS...</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Ub0QiXA2HKo/XKNXx2VbSsI/AAAAAAABge4/QvFfNvx0L4QkjkPS-FYOQm26C4PeSUQ1QCLcBGAs/s1600/Rabi%252Bcrops_%252B1.%252BTheyx%252Bare%252Bsown%252Bin%252Bwinter%252Bfrom%252BOctober%252Bto%252BDecember..jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"768\" data-original-width=\"1024\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Ub0QiXA2HKo/XKNXx2VbSsI/AAAAAAABge4/QvFfNvx0L4QkjkPS-FYOQm26C4PeSUQ1QCLcBGAs/s640/Rabi%252Bcrops_%252B1.%252BTheyx%252Bare%252Bsown%252Bin%252Bwinter%252Bfrom%252BOctober%252Bto%252BDecember..jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-PdmWKb0HBZ4/XKNYD9ze4FI/AAAAAAABgfA/lwaqbP3j7uk-PY1wXMSqUxNCwdl4nzYswCLcBGAs/s1600/MapSeasonAndThreeRDDatioforRice-26.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"1052\" data-original-width=\"1600\" height=\"420\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-PdmWKb0HBZ4/XKNYD9ze4FI/AAAAAAABgfA/lwaqbP3j7uk-PY1wXMSqUxNCwdl4nzYswCLcBGAs/s640/MapSeasonAndThreeRDDatioforRice-26.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">INTERCROPPING is the\ngrowing of two or more crops together in proximity on the same land. As a\nresult, two or more crops are managed at the same time. It differs from crop\nrotation in which two or more crops are grown one after the other. There are at\nleast four types of intercropping according to spatial arrangement <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ROW INTERCROPPING is\nthe growing of two or more crops at the same time with at least one crop\nplanted in rows. In farms grown to perennial crops, annual crops like corn,\nrice and pineapple are commonly grown as intercrop between the rows of the main\ncrop. This strategy is an efficient way of maximizing the use of farm land by\nutilizing vacant spaces while at the same time suppressing the growth of weeds\nduring the juvenile stage of the main crop.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With annuals, the\ncomponent crops are planted at the same time or the other crop(s) are planted\nduring the juvenile stage of growth (before flowering) of the first crop. In\nIndia, pigeon pea is traditionally planted with sorghum. The pigeon pea starts\nflowering after the sorghum plants are harvested.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In the United States, velvet\nbean or cowpea is planted in standing corn at the last corn cultivation. When\nthe corn plants mature, the corn stalks become natural trellis for the beans or\npeas. Both the corn and the intercrop are harvested together.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">STRIP INTERCROPPING is\nthe growing of two or more crops together in strips wide enough to allow\nseparate production of crops using mechanical implements, but close enough for\nthe crops to interact. Examples of successful strip intercropping practices in\nthe United States are: alternating strips of wheat, corn and soybean 6 rows\nwide each; oat, corn and soybean; and 6 rows of corn with 12 rows of soybean.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MIXED INTERCROPPING OR\nMIXED CROPPING is the growing of two or more crops at the same time with no\ndistinct row arrangement.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RELAY INTERCROPPING OR\nRELAY CROPPING is a system in which a second crop is planted into an existing\ncrop when it has flowered (reproductive stage) but before harvesting. There is\nthus a minimum temporal overlap of two or more crops. The relay crop should be\nfairly tolerant to shade and trampling. Examples of relay crops are cassava,\ncotton, sweet potato and sesban with corn; chickpea, lentil and wheat with\nupland rice.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN CROP ROTATION OR\nSEQUENTIAL CROPPING, two or more crops are grown one after the other in the\nsame piece of land. It is advantageous that the succeeding crop belongs to a\nfamily different from that of the previous crop. The period of crop rotation\nmay be for two to three years or longer. Farm income significantly increased by\nalternating lowland rice with high-value crops like garlic, onion, melons, bell\npepper and other vegetables.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ADVANTAGES OF CROP\nROTATION COMPARED TO MONOCULTURE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In addition to\nincreased crop yields and profit, the following are the advantages of crop\nrotation over monoculture, the continuous growing of a single crop.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Better control of\nweeds. Crop rotation is intended to break the life cycle and suppress the\ngrowth of weeds. The sequential planting of different crops may check the\ndevelopment of any weed species and reduce weed growth especially if cover\ncrops or green manures&nbsp; and\ntall-growing row crops are used as component rotation crops. It improves the\nsoil structure</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Some crops have strong, deep roots. They can break up hardpans,\nand tap moisture and nutrients from deep in the soil. Others have many fine,\nshallow roots. They tap nutrients near the surface and bind the soil. They form\nmany tiny holes so that air and water can get into the soil. Planting the same\ncrop season after season encourages certain weeds, insects and diseases.\nPlanting different crops breaks their life cycle and prevents them from\nmultiplying.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Better control of pests\nand diseases. Some pests and causal organisms of plant diseases are host\nspecific. They attack certain crop species or those belonging to the same\nfamily but not others. For example, the problem with rice stem borer will\ncontinue if rice is not rotated with other crops of a different family. This is\nbecause food will be always available to the pest. However, if legume is\nplanted as the next crop, then corn, beans and bulbs, the build up of the pest\nwill be disrupted because they will be deprived of food.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Improved soil structure\nand organic matter content. The alternate planting of deep and shallow rooted\nplants will break up the soil and reduce the effects of plow pan. The planting\nof soybean, other grain legumes, sweet potato and vegetables will return\nsufficient quantities of plant residues to the soil as their leaves drop on the\nground or body parts are left on the field after harvest, instead of being\nburned as is commonly practiced with sugarcane. Green manures will add\nsignificant amounts of organic matter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Improved soil\nfertility. The continuous growing of a single crop will result to the depletion\nof certain soil nutrients. With crop rotation, soil fertility will be promoted\nthrough alternate planting of crops having different nutrient needs. This will\nprevent the depletion of any one essential element present in the soil.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Leguminous plants, because of their ability to accumulate nitrogen by fixing it\nfrom the air in association with Rhizobium bacteria, will improve soil\nfertility. Legumes (such as groundnuts and beans) fix nitrogen in the soil.\nWhen their green parts and roots rot, this nitrogen can be used by other crops\nsuch as maize. The result is higher, more stable yields, without the need to\napply expensive inorganic fertilizer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It produces different\ntypes of output Growing a mix of grain, beans, vegetables and fodder means a\nmore varied diet and more types of produce to sell.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It reduces risk A\nsingle crop may fail because of drought. It may be attacked by pests. Or its\nmarket price may be low when time comes to sell it. Producing several different\ncrops reduces these risks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plants can only process\na certain amount of nitrogen and the remaining amount acidifies the soil and\naffects groundwater. High concentrations of ammonia are harmful to humans and\nanimals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The largest use of\nammonia is in fertilizers , which are applied to the soil <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Urea, which is made\nfrom ammonia and carbon dioxide , is being used as a feed supplement for humpledd\ncows, aiding in the rapid building of protein by the animals. This make their\ndung and urine emit fantastic amounts of potent greenhouse gas Nitrous Oxide<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The average urine from\na healthy adult will release 11g nitrogen/urea, 1g phosphorus/super-phosphate\nand 2.5g potassium. The normal range for a 24-hour urine output is 800 to 2000\nmilliliters (ml) per day with a normal fluid intake of about 2 liters per day. That\u2019s\nan average of 1400 ml per person, per day!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fresh human urine is\nsterile and so free from bacteria. Only when it is older than 24 hours, the\nurea turns into ammonia, which is what causes the distinctive smell. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Urine ( without antibiotics\n) can be used in a number of ways, such as a solution that is applied to plants\nto provide a quick, short-term boost in growth or as a nitrogen additive to the\ncarbon-based material, facilitating the composting process. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is too strong to be\nused neat on most plants and should be diluted. Dilute one part fresh urine to\n10-15 parts water for application on plants in the growth stage. Dilute one\npart fresh urine to 30-50 parts water for use on pot plants, which are much\nmore sensitive to fertilisers of any kind.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Excess diluted urine (\nsan antibiotics ) can be used on lawns and trees.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Human urine contains\nnitrogen, phosphorus and potassium \u2014</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The relative ratios are\ntypically around 11 parts nitrogen to 1 part phosphorus to 2.5 parts potassium.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While pee is almost\nalways sterile, feces contains dangerous pathogens. North Koreans have been\nforced to use human shit for fertilizer.. Most Koreans have gut health\nproblems.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrogen is so vital\nbecause it is a major component of chlorophyll, the compound by which plants\nuse sunlight energy to produce sugars from water and carbon dioxide (i.e.,\nphotosynthesis).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chlorophyll is a green\nphotosynthetic pigment found in plants, algae, and cyanobacteria.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chlorophyll absorbs\nmostly in the blue and to a lesser extent red portions of the electromagnetic\nspectrum, hence its intense green color.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Green substance in\nproducers that traps light energy from the sun, which is then used to combine\ncarbon dioxide and water into sugars in the process of photosynthesis\nChlorophyll is vital for photosynthesis, which helps plants get energy from\nlight.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Green plants are green\nbecause they contain a pigment called chlorophyll. Chlorophyll absorbs certain\nwavelengths of light within the visible light spectrum.&nbsp; Chlorophyll absorbs light in the red (long wavelength)\nand the blue (short wavelength) regions of the visible light spectrum. Green\nlight is not absorbed but reflected, making the plant appear green.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chlorophyll is found in\nthe chloroplasts of plants.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chloroplasts are the food producers\nof the cell. The organelles are only found in plant cells and some protists\nsuch as algae. Animal cells do not have chloroplasts. Chloroplasts work to\nconvert light energy of the Sun into sugars that can be used by cell<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some symptoms of\nnitrogen deficiency (in absence or low supply) are given below :<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The chlorophyll content\nof the plant leaves is reduced which results in pale yellow color. Older leaves\nturn completely yellow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Flowering, fruitings,\nprotein and starch contents are reduced. Reduction in protein results in\nstunted growth and dormant lateral buds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrogen is part of\nevery protein in the plant, so it's required for virtually every process\u2014from\ngrowing new leaves to defending against pests. Nitrogen is part of the\nchlorophyll molecule, which gives plants their green color and is involved in creating\nfood for the plant through photosynthesis.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because nitrogen can\nmove around in the plant, older growth often yellows more than the new growth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A plant with a nitrogen\ndeficiency is more susceptible to suffer from diseases and insects<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A nitrogen deficiency\ncan have several causes:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">- Excess potassium,\nzinc and manganese in the soil or substrate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">- Too much chloride in\nthe soil<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">- Too little nitrogen\navailable in the soil or substrate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">- Too high pH level in\nthe root environment<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">- Dysfunctional root\nsystem due to damage, disease or low temperatures of the soil<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">- Nitrogen is easily\nsoluble and therefore easy to wash out<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrogen &nbsp;is also a major component of amino acids, the\nbuilding blocks of proteins. Without proteins, plants wither and die. Some\nproteins act as structural units in plant cells while others act as enzymes,\nmaking possible many of the biochemical reactions on which life is based.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrogen is a component of energy-transfer compounds, such as ATP (adenosine\ntriphosphate). ATP allows cells to conserve and use the energy released in\nmetabolism. Finally, nitrogen is a significant component of nucleic acids such\nas DNA, the genetic material that allows cells (and eventually whole plants) to\ngrow and reproduce.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Without nitrogen, there would be no life as we know it.\nSoil nitrogen exists in three general forms: organic nitrogen compounds,\nammonium (NH4+) ions and nitrate (NO3-) ions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The nitrate form of\nnitrogen is so soluble that it leaches easily when excess water percolates\nthrough the soil. This can be a major loss mechanism in coarse-textured soils\nwhere water percolates freely, but is less of a problem in finer-textured, more\nimpermeable soils, where percolation is very slow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plants absorb nitrogen\nfrom the soil as both NH4+ and NO3- ions, but because nitrification is so\npervasive in agricultural soils, most of the nitrogen is taken up as nitrate.\nNitrate moves freely toward plant roots as they absorb water.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once inside the\nplant, NO3- is reduced to an NH2 form and is assimilated to produce more\ncomplex compounds. Because plants require very large quantities of nitrogen, an\nextensive root system is essential to allowing unrestricted uptake.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plants with\nroots restricted by compaction may show signs of nitrogen deficiency even when\nadequate nitrogen is present in the soil. Most plants take nitrogen from the\nsoil continuously throughout their lives, and nitrogen demand usually increases\nas plant size increases.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A plant supplied with adequate nitrogen grows rapidly\nand produces large amounts of succulent, green foliage. Providing adequate\nnitrogen allows an annual crop, such as corn, to grow to full maturity, rather\nthan delaying it.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A nitrogen-deficient plant is generally small and develops\nslowly because it lacks the nitrogen necessary to manufacture adequate\nstructural and genetic materials. It is usually pale green or yellowish because\nit lacks adequate chlorophyll.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Older leaves often become necrotic and die as\nthe plant moves nitrogen from less important older tissues to more important\nyounger ones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the other hand, some\nplants may grow so rapidly when supplied with excessive nitrogen that they\ndevelop protoplasm faster than they can build sufficient supporting material in\ncell walls. Such plants are often rather weak and may be prone to mechanical\ninjury. Development of weak straw and lodging of small grains are an example of\nsuch an effect.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrogen fertilizer is\none of the more expensive soil inputs, so farmers may be spending money they do\nnot need to spend. Another reason is the environment. When more nitrogen is\nadded than plants can use, it can run off the land and cause problems for\nbodies of water downstream.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An estimated 80 percent\nof soil carbon in heavily farmed areas has been lost due to the use of\ncarbon-depleting chemical fertilizers and pesticides.&nbsp;&nbsp; Organic carbon is stored in soil by\nexclusively binding to certain soil structures, and the soil's capacity to\nabsorb carbon dioxide is directly related to its&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Topsoil destruction, erosion\nand desertification are all exacerbated by artificial fertilizer / chemical\nuse, monocropping and not using cover crops.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">At the\ncurrent rate of topsoil degradation, all the world\u2019s topsoil will be gone in\nless than 60 years.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">At that point, it\u2019ll\nbe GAME OVER ( like in the Hollywood movie INTERSTELLAR ) because without\ntopsoil you cannot grow food no matter how many chemicals you add.&nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: x-large;\">IMAGINE , THAT IDIOT PC CHACKO WAS PRAISING THE GREEN REVOLUTION OF THE CONGRESS PARTY..</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ffAJjMGwHqM/XKT6G-yvjEI/AAAAAAABggE/6-LLM_Bw_kE1a60Zk3_gYF0VbhtxJpAdQCLcBGAs/s1600/vvdustbowl8.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"626\" data-original-width=\"800\" height=\"500\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ffAJjMGwHqM/XKT6G-yvjEI/AAAAAAABggE/6-LLM_Bw_kE1a60Zk3_gYF0VbhtxJpAdQCLcBGAs/s640/vvdustbowl8.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Closely\nrelated problems are the loss of soil fertility and biodiversity, which is\ndirectly related to the loss of natural carbon in the soil.&nbsp; The importance of carbon sequestration simply\ncannot be overstated. Not only will it reduce the carbon dioxide (CO2) load in\nthe atmosphere, but once sequestered in the soil, the carbon actively nourishes\nsoil health and improves water retention.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The biological\ncomponent of soil is an extremely important carbon sink since about 57% of the\nbiotic content is carbon. Even on desert crusts, cyanobacteria, lichens and\nmosses capture and sequester a significant amount of carbon by photosynthesis.\nPoor ARTIFICIAL farming and grazing methods have degraded soils and released\nmuch of this sequestered carbon to the atmosphere.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many foreign soils have\nan organic matter content in the top 10cm (expressed as organic carbon) of\n&gt;3%. If the organic matter falls below this level, the fertility will be greatly\nreduced. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SOC levels result from\nthe interactions of several ecosystem processes, of which photosynthesis,\nrespiration, and decomposition are key. Photosynthesis is the fixation of\natmospheric CO2 into plant biomass. SOC input rates are primarily determined by\nthe root biomass of a plant, but also include litter deposited from plant.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When\ncarbon inputs and outputs are in balance with one another, there is no net\nchange in SOC levels. When carbon inputs from photosynthesis exceed C losses,\nSOC levels increase over time. Photosynthesis, decomposition, and respiration\nrates are determined partly by climatic factors, most importantly soil temperature\nand moisture levels. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Despite the much larger\nsize of the oceanic carbon pool relative to the soil carbon pool, the rate of\nexchange between the atmosphere and the soil is estimated to be higher than\nthat between the atmosphere and the ocean.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, soil carbon sequestration is a process in which CO2 is removed\nfrom the atmosphere and stored in the soil carbon pool. This process is\nprimarily mediated by plants through photosynthesis, with carbon stored in the\nform of SOC.&nbsp; In the ground, carbon is\nuseful.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Loss of topsoil\nreleases carbon into the air.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the problems\nwith chemical fertilizers is they seep through the soil into the groundwater\nand other water sources, leading to contamination. Now, NPK can&nbsp; kill the balance of nature in various ways.&nbsp;&nbsp; Nitrogen in the water can persist for many\nyears, so it will continue to affect the environment even without adding more.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chemical fertilizers\ncan make the topsoil acidic, because nitrogen lowers the pH of the soil. The\nideal pH for maximum plant growth and crop yield is between 5.5 and 8. If the\nsoil is too acidic (pH lower than 5.5), it will yield less crops.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Food crops produced\nusing chemical fertilizers are poor in nutrition. This is because chemical fertilizers\ntrade fast growth for health in plants, resulting in crops that have less\nnutritional value. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today's vegetables may\nbe larger but they typically do not contain more nutrients. Jumbo-sized produce\noften contains more dry matter than anything else, which dilutes mineral\nconcentrations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The richly colored\n\u201cIndian corn\u201d contains far more disease-fighting antioxidants and less sugar\nthan today\u2019s popular pale yellow GM sweet corn.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">WHEN QUANTITY INCREASES QUALITY REDUCES \u2013THIS IS A UNIVERSAL LAW.</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The humpless cow gives\nplenty of toxic A1 milk which causes most of the diseases of the gut.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>AN IDIOT NAMED PC\nCHACKO WAS PRAISING THE WHITE REVOLUTION OF CONGRESS PARTY\u2014JUST BECAUSE THE\nFATHER OF THE WHITE REVOLUTION VERGHESE KURIAN &nbsp;IS A KERALA CHRISTIAN LIKE HIM.. SAME &nbsp;CHURCH &nbsp;PARTY.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/07/nutritious-a1-milk-of-vedic-cows-with.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/07/nutritious-a1-milk-of-vedic-cows-with.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plants will grow on\nlittle more than NPK, but they will be missing or developing less of essential\nnutrients such as calcium, zinc, and iron. This can have a small but cumulative\neffect on the health of people that consume them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Chemical-based agriculture has resulted in the destruction of rural economies, water and air pollution, depletion of aquifers, destruction of pollinators and biodiversity, soil erosion and loss of soil fertility, climate destabilization, food contamination, nutrient degradation and the deterioration of public health.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">&nbsp;Even the government admits about half of all American adults now live with one or more chronic diseases, many of which are rooted in a nutrient-poor diet caused due to food grown in chemical laden soil sans healthy microbes..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Organic foods contain higher amounts of antioxidants,&nbsp; and an antioxidant-rich diet is associated reduced risks for chronic diseases.&nbsp; To improve health we really need to improve nutrition, and to do that we must address food at its literal roots.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Healthy microbe-rich soil associated with regenerative, soil-centered, organic practices produces crops with higher levels of nutrients, without which maintaining health is difficult if not impossible.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/04/small-intestinal-bacterial-overgrowth.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/04/small-intestinal-bacterial-overgrowth.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/03/ibs-irritable-bowel-syndrome-vagus_14.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/03/ibs-irritable-bowel-syndrome-vagus_14.html</a></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2014/10/no-farting-please-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2014/10/no-farting-please-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plants\u2019 natural\nsymbiotic relationship with soil microorganisms is disrupted by the use of\nsynthetic fertilizer<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The use of synthetic\nfertilizers results in higher yields and bigger produce that is less\nnutrient-dense<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mineral content of\nfruits and vegetables has declined by 48% over the last five decades IN India..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chemical fertilizers\nincrease the risks of developing cancer in adults and children and adversely\naffecting fetal brain development..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The rhizosphere is the\narea immediately around a plant\u2019s root. It contains microorganisms that thrive\non chemicals released from the plant\u2019s roots. These chemicals, known as\nexudates, include carbohydrates, phytochemicals and other compounds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In exchange for the\nexudates, the root microbiome supplies the plant with important metabolites for\nhealth, which, along with exposure to pests and pathogens, helps plants produce\nphytochemicals. A well-fed root microbiome will also supply plants with ample\nnitrogen, phosphorus and potassium.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrous oxide emissions\nfrom ARTIFICIAL FERTILISER managed soils account for almost 45% of agricultural\nemissions in the EU. This is particularly important because the impact of 1\nkilo of nitrous oxide on warming the atmosphere is about 300 times greater than\nthe impact of 1 kilo of carbon dioxide.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/12/poland-katowice-cop-24-global-warming.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/12/poland-katowice-cop-24-global-warming.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NPK fertilizers\ntranslate into lower phytochemical levels. When plants grow explosively they\ntend to cut back on making phytochemicals.. Many phytochemicals produced by\nplants act as a natural defense system to protect plants from predators. When a\nbug such as a caterpillar chews on a plant's leaf, the plant \"hears\"\nthe vibrations of the chewing and produces a phytochemical to defend itself\nfrom further harm.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When crops are sprayed\nwith pesticides, herbicides, and fungicides, however, the plant has less of a\nneed to produce these in-house phytochemical weapons.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fertilizer companies\nclaim their products are necessary to feed the world, but research poves and\ndemands &nbsp;working with nature instead of\nagainst it \u2014 via agroecology or \u201cecological farming\u201d \u2014 can produce as much food\nwithout the need for chemical fertilizers. Cutting out chemical fertilizers\ncould reduce annual global greenhouse emissions by as much as 23 %..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The shift from chemical\nfertilizers to agroecological practices would allow farmers to rebuild organic\nmatter in the world's soils, and thus capture a possible two- thirds of the\ncurrent excess CO2 in the atmosphere within 40 years.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TILL THE GREEN\nREVOLUTION CAME TO INDIA, INDIA WAS CARBON NEGATIVE..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrification\ninhibitors delay the bacterial oxidation of the ammonium ion (NH4+) by\ndepressing over a certain period of time (four to ten weeks) the activity of\nNitrosomonas bacteria in the soil. These bacteria transform ammonium ions into\nnitrite (NO 2\u2013), which is further transformed into nitrate (NO3 \u2013) by\nNitrobacter and Nitrosolobus bacteria.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The objective of using\nnitrification inhibitors is to control the loss of nitrate by leaching or the\nproduction of nitrous oxide (N2O) by denitrification from the topsoil by\nkeeping N in the ammonium form longer and thus increasing N-use efficiency.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Furthermore, nitrification inhibitors \u2013 by delaying the conversion of ammonium\nto nitrate \u2013 avoid undesirable high nitrate levels in plants used for human and\nanimal nutrition.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">\u201cNeem Oil \u201cis a proven\nnitrification inhibitor. It slows down the process of nitrogen release from\nNitrogenous Fertilisers.&nbsp; &nbsp; PM Modi keeps boasting about urea coated with neem oil- but he has no idea how it works.. He thinks it is to prevent hijacking of urea to make explosives..</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-tokR5QZCs2Y/XKVBe-R_5MI/AAAAAAABggs/X3m9AJMokTMNmUtVmHP3mqoDmMYCsGtvgCLcBGAs/s1600/x08prop.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"377\" data-original-width=\"400\" height=\"301\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-tokR5QZCs2Y/XKVBe-R_5MI/AAAAAAABggs/X3m9AJMokTMNmUtVmHP3mqoDmMYCsGtvgCLcBGAs/s320/x08prop.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-e48QrXOXJbs/XKU9NNPHKMI/AAAAAAABggM/Qdh_oi32C3QMQgS-Trn9EsPYuj_wKZYUwCLcBGAs/s1600/nd_stabilizers4.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"381\" data-original-width=\"375\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-e48QrXOXJbs/XKU9NNPHKMI/AAAAAAABggM/Qdh_oi32C3QMQgS-Trn9EsPYuj_wKZYUwCLcBGAs/s400/nd_stabilizers4.gif\" width=\"392\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-4Hm9tUUin0w/XKU9cXYGrgI/AAAAAAABggQ/EBT5waq7O9sk617KFheH9I1k-ttuON_WQCLcBGAs/s1600/cq5dam.wddeb.2-3.12.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"1600\" data-original-width=\"1067\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-4Hm9tUUin0w/XKU9cXYGrgI/AAAAAAABggQ/EBT5waq7O9sk617KFheH9I1k-ttuON_WQCLcBGAs/s1600/cq5dam.wddeb.2-3.12.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-q0wluILvjDA/XKU-bhPRKCI/AAAAAAABggc/bSXjOsJp27goMaxgyLX-4bN0aIZBkSJpgCLcBGAs/s1600/dimages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"148\" data-original-width=\"341\" height=\"138\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-q0wluILvjDA/XKU-bhPRKCI/AAAAAAABggc/bSXjOsJp27goMaxgyLX-4bN0aIZBkSJpgCLcBGAs/s320/dimages.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-8gh80LGXCi4/XKVA_9jyI-I/AAAAAAABggk/9NGFGIFHBakzpn8JcpIEBQuUNkpVDVragCLcBGAs/s1600/5b089ed04dd17228bfbbedd4fc_UW-Nitrogen-Stabilizers-Diagram1.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"1001\" data-original-width=\"1600\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-8gh80LGXCi4/XKVA_9jyI-I/AAAAAAABggk/9NGFGIFHBakzpn8JcpIEBQuUNkpVDVragCLcBGAs/s640/5b089ed04dd17228bfbbedd4fc_UW-Nitrogen-Stabilizers-Diagram1.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you apply urea to\nthe soil as source of nitrogen fertilizer, it will hydrolyze into ammonia very\nfast. Ammonia is a gas under normal temperature and pressure condition. The\nloss of this gas into the atmosphere is economically substantial.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This\nhydrolysis process is facilitated by the enzyme urease. So, urease inhibition\nis the process of slowing down this hydrolysis process to minimize N loss. The\nmechanism is that those chemicals considered as urease inhibitors will bind the\nenzyme urease thus slowing down its effect in urease hydrolysis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Urease Inhibitor is a\nsubstance which inhibits hydrolytic action on urea by urease enzyme. When\napplied to soils&nbsp; a urease inhibitor\nresults in less urea nitrogen lost by ammonia volatilization Urease inhibitors\nblock the conversion&nbsp; of urea to ammonia\nfor a period of one to two weeks..</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrogen Stabilizer is\na substance added to a fertilizer which extends the time the nitrogen component\nof the&nbsp; fertilizer remains in the soil in\nthe [urea or] ammoniacal&nbsp; form</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/iaP1aSDidKg/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/iaP1aSDidKg?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE MUST RECLAIM OUR\nHOLY TOP SOIL WHICH PRODUCED DIVINE FOOD WITH VEDIC GOLDEN MEAN 1.618\nINHERENT..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">JUST 55 YEARS OF GREEN\nREVOLUTION ( ARTIFICIAL FERTILISERS / PESTICIDES ) OF DESH DROHI MS\nVISHWANATHAN -FATHER OF GREEN REVOLUTION-- HAS KILLED 90% OF INDIAN LAKES WHICH\nWERE IN PRISTINE CONDITION FOR MORE MILLIONS OF YEARS ..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<ol id=\"top-ra\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c254157206323747656\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img alt=\"\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/03/india-must-revert-to-organic_26.html?showComment=1554353833441#c254157206323747656\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">April 4, 2019 at 10:27 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nSTUPID FELLOW PC CHACKO WAS PRAISING THE GREEN AND WHITE REVOLUTION OF THE CONGRESS..<br />\n<br />\nHE MUST READ THE BLOG POST BELOW-- TWO PARTS..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/03/india-must-revert-to-organic_26.html<br /><br />https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/04/questions-from-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</span><br />\n<br />\nIN SIX DECADES IF THE PLANET DOES NOT GO BACK TO ORGANIC FARMING, WE WILL LAND UP IN A \"INTERSTELLAR\" MOVIE SCENARIO WHERE THE TOPSOIL OF THE PLANET IS TOTALLY DEPLETED, UNABLE TO PRODUCE FOOD..<br />\n<br />\nTHE WHITE REVOLUTION IN INDIA IS THE REASON WHY EVIL PHARMA IS SINGING ALL THE WAY TO THE KOSHER BANKS AS AYURVEDA SAYS 90% DISEASES ORIGINATE IN THE HUMAN GUT..<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br />IF JAGAN MOHAN REDDY BECOMES CM OF ANDHRA HE MUST SCRAP THE CAPITAL CITY PLANS FOR AMARAVATHI.. CHANDRABABU NAIDU WAS IN A TEARING HURRY FOR PERSONAL BENEFIT..</span></b><br />\nFIRST OF ALL AMARAVATHI ANCIENT BUDDHIST CENTRE IS A COOKED UP HOAX..<br />\n<br />\nTHE SOIL OF AMARAVATHI IS SOFT AND UNSUITABLE .. 15% EXTRA MONEY WILL HAVE TO BE WASTED IN BUILDING STRONG FOUNDATIONS OF BUILDINGS..<br />\n<br />\nTHE SOIL IS PRONE TO LIQUEFACTION. DONT WE HAVE THINKERS IN INDIA?..<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br />https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/10/soil-liquefaction-during-earth-quakes.html</span><br />\n<br />\nTHE KRISHNA RIVER WILL DIE IF AMARAVATHI CITY COMES UP..<br />\n<br />\nWHY ARE WE SACRIFICING A FERTILE AREA WHICH IS THE FOOD BOWL OF ANDHRA WITH THREE CROPS A YEAR ?..<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..<br
